That would be something I'd come back for. Otherwise... it's off to try the next steak place!

ftqx452mWfHRa93XDn7TzQ.text: Great restaurant experience here. Excellent service, perfectly cooked steak and delish crispy French fries. We had the house red wine which was also very good. They have a location in New York too that I want to try :)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. My steak and fries! I want this again :)

yEJ7qGFNpqHegwsggHpM8w.text: Le Relais de venise only does one thing, but it does it well: steak frittes. On being seated, the server will ask how you want your steak cooked - if you're vegetarian and/or have a nut allergy, this is your opportunity to shout. The green salad brought to you before your main has walnuts on top, but if you ask for them to be left off, it's not a problem. What may be a bigger problem is that the chips are cooked in groundnut oil - if you have a peanut allergy, you will starve.I believe vegetarians can substitute their steak for a lot of cheese, but it's an expensive option. £24 for steak frittes or £24 for fromage frittes with a dessert. If you're a veggie, I just wouldn't bother.The steak is brought to you in two parts, which effectively works out as two giant plates of cow and chips, so it's a big undertaking. My advice is to skip lunch because if you can't finish the main, you will be disappointed with yourself.The desserts are around the £5/£6 mark and are nice (the crème brûlée is a reliable offering) however you will probably be too full to manage one. House wine (around £5 a glass, £10 for a carafe, £20 for a bottle) is drinkable enough.You can't book a table even if you're a group, so eat early (5.30pm) or expect to queue out the door. Although tables are a little close, that's because there are a lot of people who want to get in and don't mind sitting on their neighbours.All in all, this isn't a cheap meal, but it's a substantial one, cooked well.

Jzt9FauezyAWJ-T4u39BPA.text: This is my second time here for dinner. I won't say the food isn't good but what I can say is the service is really a DISASTER! One girl who served at our table always put on a shit face and was very rude. We had four people here and she was keeping pushing the table to my friends side which made them really uncomfortable, and she didn't say anything about that. Apart from that, my friends went shopping afternoon so they had some big bags, in case that those would block the aisle, they saved their belongings temporarily at the cloakroom. When we about to leave and asked staff to get the stuff back, one girl just stared at us with very disgusting face and chose to ignore us.So, if you want to experience this kind of world standard shit service, please come here, I bet you've got little temper to lose here.

0x0ywubMzgS36GU7bwR3VQ.text: YES! FINALLY A RESTAURANT THAT COOKS MY STEAK THE WAY I LIKE IT! (sorry for the all-caps intro, but I'm just so happy!!)So, anyone who, like me, likes their steak rather under than over and is getting tired of the whole 'the least we can cook it is medium rare' bullsh*t, head to Le Relais de Venise. But with the food being so good and the whole thing being VERY good value for money, you'll most probably have to queue. Though chances are I'll be in the queue too, so maybe we can have a little chat then?

6kY7slA0vV5RrMwiFTH34Q.text: My first Le Relais experience was in Paris where I accidentally walked into that restaurant. And I enjoyed that experience. When I learned that there was another version in London, I had to make sure I had to bookmark it on my trip here.Walking in the London version, it even feels like you're in Paris. The tables are very cramped and that you are literally right next to another stranger only inches away. So you need to pull out the table to move around.And just like the Paris versions, there are no menus. Just steak and frites with a small salad in the beginning. But it's the sauce that makes this place standout compared to other steak joints. It has a nice, tangy vinaigrette flavor that only this restaurant can provide. The steaks by themselves are just normal steaks, served in only "Rare" or "Medium." Even "medium rare" is not allowed. Again, just rare or medium here in London.And just like the Paris version, you get your second serving shortly after you finished your first plate. And as for the dessert, you may need one of the French waitresses to help you out since the menu is in French. But I went with the Profiteroles au chocolat. Nice warm chocolate smothering some vanilla ice cream with shaved walnuts. Now that is a great way to finish the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Profiteroles au chocolat
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Steak and frites
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Salad

DXv5EpAku7KPJecp-4gSmg.text: Excellent, faultless meal.The service was attentive and efficient, but most importantly -- savvy. We all know they're trying to get customers through quickly (this place must make a FORTUNE!); however, I never felt even a little rushed. Everything was perfectly timed to allow us to enjoy a relaxed meal.The house Bordeaux is super drinkable, not overly tannic, and well-balanced (even if slightly lacking in depth), with a seemingly minimal price markup for a bottle. What you get is what you come for. Delicious steak and fries. It's an excellent and simple meal perfectly executed. What more does one need to say? Show up early if you don't want to wait, otherwise, expect to wait!

hAXUOnTjcF7bow4bYYTpfw.text: It's one of those London things.. although not exclusively. Sauce is delicious. Meat is good quality. Salad is yummy too! No nonsense place for a fun casual meal.

Us3nQg5NCFCDNfRqzkjXdA.text: The steak was excellent. I loved it. The fries were excellent--very crisp without being dry and not too fat. The sauce was probably the best part about it, however. I feel like I've gotten comparable steak and fries elsewhere, but the sauce really brought the whole dish together. It really makes you wanna go back for more and more! I will say, however, that I've had better steak elsewhere. I may have a skewed view, though, because I had a really intense conversation with relatives while eating there and was somewhat distracted. Overall, though, this place was amazing! I'd totally come here again if I am in the neighborhood.

U6rxyrEcegXNryl9RohzWQ.text: I was meeting a girlfriend for lunch and she wanted to go to Le Relais de Venise.  I was excited because it's in my neighbourhood and I've been wanting to check it out because I've heard great things about it.Food: There's no menu.  They only serve steak frites and as much as you want of it.  They will ask how you would like your meat cooked.  They then start off with a simple salad, the steak comes in small slices, frites and a wonderful sauce that makes you want more.  Very simple.Drinks: We ordered one sprite and tap water.Price: 56.10 GBP for two people.Ambiance: The restaurant feels like a true bistro in Paris.  It was very crowded and bustling for lunch.  It's first come, first serve and they will not seat your party until everyone is there.  Service: This is why I gave three stars.  Here's where everything went wrong.  The service was horrible.  Our server was a woman who seemed like she hated her job.  She didn't have the time of day for us.  She was very unfriendly, curt, rude and kept bumping into my girlfriend's chair without even saying I'm sorry.  There was a table next to us that was empty and when they were about to seat two people she looked at the diners, said "oh sh*t" and then slammed down the cutlery and glasses onto the table.  The icing on the cake was when she was serving me the frites and dropped one in to my water glass.  She didn't apologise or even come back to replace my water.  I waited for 10 minutes, asked for a new glass of water only to find her very annoyed.Would I go back?  Maybe.  I wouldn't rush back and if I did go back I would definitely not sit in the section of that server if she's still there.

TwjIVKNGVeubkA4p4NH5pA.text: Love this place. No choices, just a question of how you want your steak cooked. Amazing salad; a few wine choices. This is the epitome of do one thing and do it well.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful wine

LtMcyakbAo7YZRvPUk8KbQ.text: One of the best restaurants in the chain compared to other locations. Always good prompt service and the food is great. You know it's good when there is such a line outside waiting to get in, so it may be better to turn up a little bit earlier than you want to eat, just in case.

hpX_katA6e02Vyyu7trwNg.text: They only have one entree on the menu and that is steak. When you get there, you are asked, how do you want your steak. So the only other decision you have to make it is what to drink and what dessert to order. They serve a good, fresh and healthy salad. Then comes the most sumptuous steak ever. Melt in your mouth, flavourful steak, with chips (fries). When you are done, they bring you a second serving of steak and chips.Amazing food, fast efficient service, and very affordable. One of my favourite spots in London, as well as in Geneva. Be prepared to wait in line as they don't accept reservations. I have stood in line on weekdays as well.

MYBR_w93qbCnU0erkTupkQ.text: The steak was good but not as good as some of the other locations. The restaurant was crowded and the service staff did not care much. We went quite early so even though they don't take reservations we were able to get a table fast.

GPlDf9CBQ9yhYay3_wqymQ.text: It's a good dinner but just prepare to wait in the long line around the corner. It's all you can eat so you do get some bang for your buck. I do think there are better places  to get steak. The meat wasn't particularly good and the tight tables are a bit claustrophobic.

dSxvehaIMJzIfbzz_egNdg.text: I hate decisions.So, you can see...that means I quite love Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote (especially when a colleague selects it, and the time) -- even though I can scarcely remember the ordering of its name. I assure you though, once you've been -- you'll never forget! To do but one thing so well, is sometimes as magical as the green sauce the steak and chips come drizzled in. What LRdVLE lacks in choice, it makes up for 10-fold in quality. You'll get this, my pretties: 1. Steak. (the ONE option is -- "how would you like this cooked?")2. Salad. 3. Chips. 4. Greeeeeeeeeen sauce. In perpetuity. Served by lovely French people in trim black and white uniforms. Quite fabulous for a business lunch (though it does fill up quickly) -- as you'll not be waiting around for everyone to make decisions and can be back to your office swiftly. The guesswork has been removed. You'll be having steak. And salad. And chips. And that green sauce everyone moans about for days and days... And if you're like me, you'll be thrilled. Yum. So French and so disciplined. *no reservations. *great deals at their Canary Wharf location, ask the servers.

X9o2iNHfuFY6T4KA4bBUOQ.text: There is only one thing on the menu, apparently that's a bit of a trend around London right now (see Burger & Lobster). Delicious steak and frites, which also comes with a starter salad. The steak sauce is super buttery so prepare for a post meal coma. Also neat how they serve your main in two portions so the second half stays hot, thoughtful!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Steak and frites
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Salad

FQTZnIhMsWYYw9NQipXIRA.text: Bloody Hell (for lack of a better commonwealth expression, I apologize), this place is fabulous!I arrived at 6pm (when they open for dinner) sharp after attending the theater, and the line was already one block long!  We were the last group to be seated snagging the final open table, and we had a minimal wait of 10 minutes.  If I had to wait 45 minutes, I would have done it gladly.Intriguing fact number 1: There was no menu. I was so confused. My date (sister in law) was getting the giggles off the bat watching me trying to piece together this culinary puzzle. A lady came to take our order, simply asking how we liked our meat. Strange, what if I wanted fish....? I said rare, and then she took a marker to my side of the table with a large "R" (clearly it is paper table cloths!) Intriguing fact number 2: Then they brought out a salad. I didn't ask for a salad, but I certainly didn't send it back!  Butter leaf lettuce with walnuts and a mustard vinegrette. It was so simple and yum! Then the waitress came to the table and served me beautifully butterflied steak strips with a green sauces and hot chips.  The chips were long, skinny and crunchy!  And the meat, well, it was one of the best meals I've ever had. The meat is imported from Scotland, and it is in a league of it's own!!!  Intriguing fact number 3: I got my entree, twice! Oh yes, what is better than one delicious meal? Having two helpings of it! SO don't worry when you polish off your plate.... more is coming!!!Head out there (early) so that you can roll out of there like I did, content and happy as a clam. I wish we had one of these in Nor cal because I would be there all the time!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Waiting in line to get in!!!

Lej2HgIK26j2I_uKhRS47Q.text: You ever meet those people that are really, REALLY good at one thing? Like, you have that roommate you went to school with who knows trivia from "The Matrix" movies better than anyone, or there was that girl you crushed on who could mop the floor with anyone on Wednesday nights when the local pub is having trivia for the week and the theme is H.P. Lovecraft and you're both impressed and terrified? This place is like your friend, only they are incredibly good at serving steak and fries. Oh, and being awesomely personable. And being able to tolerate a table of out-of-towners (from Texas, to boot) with the patience and sass of someone who can easily blend patience and sass while also convincing me to have not one but two scotches after a bottle of wine. Yes, this place and the staff are that good.We arrived around 8:00 on a Friday night per the recommendations of the locals. The place is a small restaurant with a line wrapping around the corner and extending back into a corner of an alley where you can look up at the guy living in the apartment across from the place who methodically paces while on the phone and organizes his shoe collection (sorry guy who lives across the place - but your shoe collection is boss). There's a reason people are willing to wait 45+ minutes in the cold and rain for this place. And if you're still reading this review, you're about to find out why.We probably waited around 25 minutes, but we got lucky. A professional and polite hostess greeted us at the door when our turn in line had come and we were walked to a table in a crowded dining room. Let there be no doubt: L'Entrecote has figured out how to maximize their space and the maximum occupancy here is probably 6,000 despite being the size of my hotel's lobby. You'll be making new friends at your table, such as the traveling couple next to us who were absolutely sweet, so if you're shy, you may need to get over that real quick.Our waitress came over and took our order and immediately panic sunk in. No "medium rare" steak?! Send me back to Texas where our beef is still moo-ing when you cut into it! Turns out there was nothing to fear as the "medium" steak was heavenly. My advice would be to placate the salad beforehand and save room for the main course. Don't get me wrong - the salad may rock your socks off but the steak and fries will also send your socks to the cleaners and bring them back with a complimentary breath mint. The whole place operates on a "steak and fries are our entrees" menu, and there's a reason: the sauce. If you've tasted their sauce and found it anything less than a miracle on your plate, please book a trip to the local funeral parlor because you clearly were born without a soul. I went back for seconds, another in our party went back for thirds. Add all this up on our bottle of red wine and you have a meal fit for anyone who plans on eating themselves into a coma. This doesn't even take dessert into consideration, with the absolute best profiteroles I have ever had. Bonus tip for those of you still reading: get a round of scotch (or two, in my case) with the profiteroles. Not only will the sweetest bartender in the world deliver them, but you will find out that this is a combo no one can beat without some serious effort.Speaking of the sweet staff, everyone working here is an undercover angel. I'm convinced of it. I never call out staff in my reviews but our server, Asia, was phenomenal. She not only put up with our relentless questions and my request for scotch after wine and port, but she did it with a level of quick wit that immediately endeared her with all of us. The team here helps each other out, with one girl removing empty glasses deftly and naturally, the bartender delivering scotch with a divine smile, and the food runners polished and focused on their destination. Make no mistake, the reason this place operates as efficiently as it does is because of the immaculate workers under the roof.Sure, you can knock on them for wanting to turn a table quickly to get the line out the door moving, and you can complain about the limited menu. Doing either of those is providing a grave disservice to this establishment, a hearty dining option filled with delicious food, professional staff and a diverse enough dessert menu to ensure you need to come back. And if this is your first time eating here, I genuinely envy you and what you are about to experience.

5J2yqMZgTkZEMc-AMGIJUg.text: After a little confusion about whether this was an all you can eat place (it isn't), a group of 8 of us headed here for dinner while in London. After looking on Yelp I was really worried about just how long we'd have to queue for but thankfully on a Thursday if you arrive around 6 - 6.30, you won't have to wait at all. Score!We were seated at a large table and they quickly took our orders - I mean, super quickly. The only thing available is the steak and chips (with a salad to start) and they simply ask how you want it done. Options are blue, rare, medium and well done. I went for rare as I figured this being their speciality it was better to go for less cooked than over cooked. I didn't particularly enjoy the salad starter, to be it was just a normal kind of salad with dressing. There was also bread on the side which again, didn't win me over as it was just a standard kind of baguette. When the steak arrived though, I was in heaven. Lovely and pink with a delicious gravy kind of sauce and a good portion of chips. I quite like that they served your meat in two goes although I'm sure the second portion that was served to me was my workmates order of blue steak as it was a hell of a lot more bloody than my first portion (that being said, I still ate it). Service here is weird - they are all aloof and abrupt. I didn't realise we were still in those days of service, I thought that died along with Gordon Ramsay's popularity in the early 2000s. Stuffy, unfriendly service is never going to win me over no matter how good the food is. If the staff were a bit more upbeat and accommodating this place would have been upgraded to 5 stars for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. I want another!

MmP_M3phNZFjmJzL1HAUeQ.text: If there is a crowd waiting outside, do not fret! The service is extremely quick. If you like steak and frites, come here (because this is all they offer).  The salad has a simple mustard dressing.  The steak is covered in a green sauce that is amazing. The frites are fried to perfection. :)

e77_3Wu1d14XP0cgslsBew.text: Simple set menu with everything cooked perfectly! Sometimes it's nice to have very few options. This place does one thing very well. Steak and frites!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Cooked perfectly!

hj8j1YljA2C2J1XaVZx0RA.text: This was one of the first meals that I had in London and it was really good. This restaurant is known for two things, steak and fries. The restaurant loves serving this so much that it is actually the only two things they have on the whole menu.  The steak was cooked perfectly. Also just when you think you are done they bring you out more steak and fries so that you can have even more.  The waiters and waitresses are just nice but not the friendliest of people I have ever met.  The food was really good, but the place inside was not the largest.  The best part about this place is the simplicity of it and the fact that you know your going to get good steak and good fries when you come here.  I would highly recommend to people looking for steak and fries in London to try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Room
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Dining room
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Serving station

gcaWD9NiMKd-m8YTbr2jcg.text: This is probably one of my favorite places in London. The atmosphere is very good inside, always crowded so may be you will need to wait outside to wait for your table! But trust me it worth it. There is no menu only one menu salad, meat and chips thats it. But everything is cooked with heart and Quality always same. Enjoy it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Salad here is amazing
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Dinner with friends in London. Very good place to eat the meat

kQqDqU3ioYwUsMN804BZEg.text: Just amazing. The most delicious restaurant for steak and fries in London. I've been to the one in Paris, and the one in New York City and they are all spectacular. This one does not disappoint. And if you see a line out front don't worry it moves quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom

9CBrLFKy20o_UYV2an2UAg.text: A great dinner here with two close friends.  Atmosphere and pace is frenetic, but the close tables and loud conversation levels leads to a very communal experience.The steak Porte Maillot with "special sauce" was executed perfectly...especially since it is the only main dish on the menu!  You simply chose the "doneness" of the meat.  By American standards, we ordered the "medium" version and it came out medium-rare (my actual preference)...just know this to help determine your desired meat temp.The salad was simple and elegant, three total ingredients and that mustard-based dressing was certainly unusual but quite tasty!We shared a bottle of their house (red) wine and I had a nice dessert with ice cream and bitter chocolate "balls" (les profiteroles au chocolat).A fantastic meal in a lively setting, what more could you want?

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Steak Porte Maillot with "special sauce"
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. House salad
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Les profiteroles au chocolat

fJpEOMYksgO80YUrBeYLvA.text: Delicious food, friendly customer service...I love the  sauce it is definitely special and hard to find any where else. I can't wait to go back here in my next visit to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Fresh salad
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Yummy steak

_vCskCF2t0FRohOWAv-nVA.text: Mmmm this place takes the cake in how to create a hype, not much to write home about.. Dresserts aren't bad though

KPj5Z2jp9JzUJ6r_uwKogQ.text: A little bit of Paris in London. The authentic Entrecôte right in the heart of Marleybone. From the service to the atmosphere to the food it's exactly like the original in Paris. Well done! This will be a regular stop on my London trips

NmGwzVaXaJi95HeHjO5kUA.text: We went for lunch and loved it.  It's a fixed menu that includes a green salad, thinly sliced steak, and French fries.  When you think you're done, you aren't because they will bring your second serving of meat.  The quality of the food was excellent and the atmosphere very nice too, although tables are very close together.

iTh4uDllhqeQlnOvLndQ1Q.text: When there's one item on the menu, you better believe they get that right. Your only choice is "How would you like that cooked?". I picked medium rare, but the waitress informed me that this is cooked in the French style and medium would equal my idea of a medium rare.A salad was delivered first, which was greatly appreciated! The salad was a really nice, light touch to what would be a heavy hearty meal. Then the steak arrived with french fries, both which melted in your mouth.For dessert, we ordered the tower of ice cream and meringue (i forgot what it was called) and the profiteroles. The latter was my favorite of the two.

szKqaKsIVYKUx0vq0e8pgQ.text: Excellent steak. Love the "Secret Sauce" great service. Opens at 1800. Be there early or stand in line.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom

5T4QFULyXZACdRFdrJEWOQ.text: Excellent food. Perfect salade, perfect steak, sauce and fries. 4 stars and not 5 because you can't book and the queue can be horrendous.

j9X3i4bsgIfzfuGfvPitIg.text: Melt in your mouth steak L'entricote with that classic sauce they do. I don't know what exactly is in it, but always ask for an extra pot on the side it's so damn good. Just when you think you've devoured it all, they come back with a full second portion of all this too. Ohhh seconds?? Yes please.All this is after you enjoy a wardorf salad as part of your main, which is fab too.This place has a few restaurants around town as well as NYC and Paris were it originated from. With one thing on the menu, sit back, order a glass of red wine and wait for the sensory delights to arrive (twice). It's consistently good whichever branch I've been at (note- I once went Canary Wharf and they had 50% off at weekends).

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom

0sM-sgeFanZC4QwuIBw7hw.text: "WOOHOO! AS GOOD AS IT GETS" definitely describes this place. A friend first brought me here on a cold day where we ended up waiting 20 minutes for a table. But I came back the following week with friends, and then again with my family, until we figured out it was best to come before it opens to be the first wave of customers in. And then it became a regular thing with anyone visiting, ever. Or any catch up, or any birthday celebrations - yes - we're going to Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote for dinner.The experience starts with a mouth watering walnut salad with this yummy sauce, but the unspeakably good star of the show is the sauce that comes with the steak. Let me rewind a bit and say that steak and fries is all you're gonna get. You tell the waitress how you like it (blue, rare, medium or well done - there is no in-betweens), she writes it on the table and off she goes. When it comes out - you are presented with a plate of delicious steak and fries to mop up all the excess sauce you manage not to cram in on every single bite. I was so shocked the first time I came here because, as normal, I finished my meal in record time still lusting for more. AND MORE THERE WAS. The waitress comes back with the SECOND HALF (?!?!) of your meal, the steak that was still in the kitchen so that it won't go cold, and an extra helping of fries. Lord have mercy.And once you think you can't go on, you have a look around and get massive food envy as all these delicious looking desserts start piling out. Now, I don't speak french so you're just gonna have to figure this one out on the menu yourself but the MUST orders are the profiteroles (which I usually don't like, but these are filled with vanilla ice cream instead of cream and are DELICIOUS!) and this stack of ice cream, meringue, praline, amazingness.This place is definitely a 10/10 in my books!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Both must get desserts!
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom

dKaqjByIahGgR2opvcZehg.text: I don't understand what the whole fuss is about: we waited in the queue outside (or in American term: we waited in the line!) Then we were served two small portions of steak with a special sauce but frankly speaking I had much better steaks but the fries was great. The waitress was super serious and when we asked to have our photo taken, she commented that if it is quick! I know it is hectic but a photo at most takes 10 seconds! Anyway, I don't think I will go back here.

WMEmSxb5UoI-SdtY1H-tqA.text: I was told rare is bleeding but what I really got was medium rare, no blood, and the famous sauce that was really just supplementary rather then complimentary to the very mediocrely cooked meat...

QNh-TLr-rEqrpNNVfOm0GQ.text: Intimate and vibrant french restaurant that serves up only one dish, which is steak and frites. The cut is "La Entrecôte" which is the cut from the ribs.You only need to make two choices:1. What to drink?2. How you like your meat prepared; rare, medium or wellAfter that it is cruise control. The meal starts with salad dressed with a mustard dressing and bread. Next comes the delicious steak and frites. The surprise is the second serving of both steak and frites. That put a smile on my face.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Steak and Frites

SF_aaCk5OI5E866uWs6J1Q.text: Yes, it hit the spot!  Simple and Delicious steak and frites! That sauce is A+Highlights:  Steak cooked to perfection with generous portions of frites...plus SECONDS! Reasonably priced, Good and fast service all inside a nice, clean and big dinning area.  Also, desserts are awesome.  Can improve:  Take reservations and Give Ketchup or Tomato Sauce.Benchmark:  I am not a big steak & frites guy and even I found it irresistible.  They set the steak & frites benchmark in my book.Word of advice:  They don't take reservations so go early when they open for dinner around 7 pm and you should have no problem getting a table.Dined in April 2016 and will definitely return.

WgMEI_YXrq7ydcBVuEPiKQ.text: We arrived when they opened and got right in.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious.  I loved that I didn't have to decide what to eat, just told them how I like my meat cooked and they take it from there. The salad was fresh and delicious, they provided bread which was crispy on the outside and soft inside.  The steak was perfectly sliced and done to my liking. The sauce was amazing, and the fries were perfectly cooked.  They even offer you a second helping if you want. For desert we tried the Le Vacherin du Relais, it was layers of meringue and ice cream topped with hot chocolate and whip cream - it was incredible. I wish they had a location in Los Angeles where I live.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Salad
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. French bread
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. Perfectly cooked meat and fries with a great sauce.

6rLKWVMFMiWvVYRXmA0qcg.text: This place had only our reserved table free when we arrived, it was packed and I understood why after we ate! The menu is set and in my opinion, perfect. They start you off asking how you like your meat and then bring you a little tasty salad with a mustard vinaigrette. Shortly after you finish your salad they bring you a plate with a semi small amount of steak in peppercorn sauce and fries. Don't worry about the size! They come around after you've eaten your way through it with plate refills of fries AND steak! I was full from my first plate (looks can be deceiving with size! Eyes bigger than stomach!) I can say without any doubt this is the best steak I've ever eaten. It was cooked perfectly and the meat was flawless, zero gristle to trim and full of flavor. I had a delightful Peruvian beer with dinner and creme brûlée for dessert - my man had a small bottle of red wine. The waitress was friendly and checked in with us a few times. I dream of this meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. YESSS

ivAAOtQAcwfm0E2J3Yt3kQ.text: Choice is over - rated, particularly when at the end of an over - stimulating day the perfect trifecta is a carnivore's dream served with a  heaping portion of crisp - to - perfection chips and a decent (drinkable) house red wine.  But wait, the surprise is in the second round of the same, so hold off on mediocre bread, and indulge in heaping round two. As you well know by the rest of these reviews, you are choice - less on menu options here, other than the temperature of the meat, and my advice  - just say bloody rare...I admit that I wasn't entirley oozing with love of the service or the 'all -business, no mingleness' of the server but it/she, like the food was reliable and uncomplicated.  It is yes, as it sounds - the perfect affair, ticks all of your needs, remains consistent and is never complicated.   I would say just who doesn't love a bloody steak and mound of perfect chips, but I imagine Jains, Jivamukti Yoga practitioners and Heather Mills might become irrational at this suggestion. If in fact you are of the few which like your steak trimmed and well-prepared, and your sauces basic, it is a simple must try at least once.8:30 on a Weds = queue which moves fairly rapidly, but be forewarned, if you want to eat with the rest of the neighbourhood consultants wear gloves.

hlNxrcHlhOUrQhDFZYv1-A.text: It does what it says on the box.  Salad, steak, fries.  And an excellent sauce - something like anchovies, pesto, and more butter than even butter contains.FYI, I like the City restaurant more than the Marylebone restaurant since it's less busy and you never have to wait.

sLrWbh2zrWO1Nw6I7eNMiA.text: Set menu, starter and main. Really simple and really tasty.  Salad, steak and frites... what more could you want? Great for lunch.

4kBn5Kp5hj29vDriNNSalg.text: Set menu. You get a two course meal. First course: streak and frites. Second course: more steak and frites. You can have your steak prepared one of four ways: blue, rare, medium, well done. Don't even bother trying to deviate from one of the four options; medium rare is not an acceptable option and you will be scoffed at for the request. It's on the pricey side but definitely worth it if you're a steak fan. I am not a steak fan and I still enjoyed myself and the food. I'd definitely come back if I were in London again. Just a side note: dress schfancy.

tCoVzzgnhGAPAxfeneBkYQ.text: This is probably one of my favourite restaurants in London. It is definitely fair to say that I agree with some of the poor reviews below but this is mainly down to fussy eating/not wholly realising the concept before going.One thing to understand is that this is NOT a take your time over several bottles of wine place  the service is rushed and there is always a queue outside! The menu is fixed but if you are a fan of steak frites, this is definitely the place for you!I think £20 for a three course meal is pretty reasonable in London. Admittedly some wine included would be nice but hey, treat yourself.Perfect place to go if you want to squeeze dinner in before a show on the West End or have the evening sightseeing in London.

GbtSkmhlH5X0ofaSo4IPsQ.text: Gorgeous place - wait in line (its worth it...) -get seated - quickfire the waitress arrives -eat salad with mustard dressing and walnuts and french fresh bread-  very nice fries and thin beautifully cooked steak in green sauce arrives - have a glass of wine- share your dessert - and go on your way .  They don't rush you ..but you know the deal ..take an hour have a great meal ..rare ?medium? well done? A lovely professional French experience, will go here lots and lots. Perfect for Sunday lunchtime or any evening you can't think where to go. Delicious , More professional restaurants please !! Love it !

C3NcQIrwe8gmB2FmnejGZQ.text: I'm pretty sure my husband would kick the world's cutest puppy just for a chance to go here every night of the week.  Me... well, I think it's pretty good, too.  Not kick-a-puppy-worthy, but very good.  Big fan of the house wine (it's well priced at 15 GBP a bottle), the waitresses in their cute little French maid outfits, and the prompt service.  The oft-dreaded no-reservations policy is a drag, but the line always moves quickly.  Do yourself a favour and get there at 18:30, and there won't be a wait at all!   It's really one of the best values in London, the land of over-priced everything.

nQJ1qytNfxT4tiMZ9EkE0Q.text: Sooooooo simple, yet sooooo good!!!! Even the salad!

b5YLs916MK1EaHFXT7TdKw.text: The best meal we had in London! Close seating like a Parisian cafe and efficient service. This place is a well oiled machine!The food was great! No complaints at all, and I love that you get extra steak and fries :) We had the *delish* profiteroles for dessert even though I could barely fit them in my belly. Attentive, friendly service too. I thought it was a bit hard to find (being an outsider) so we took a cab- if you're coming from near Piccadilly it's only £6 and totally worth it!

kv3FBZQEXAuBeu9d9s5goA.text: I've long been a fan of the Relais de L'Entrecôte restaurants in Paris (3) and Geneve (1), but somehow until recently had failed to spot this one more on my own doorstep (all are run by members of the original founder's extended family).A simple concept - "Steak/Frites Plus" - but well executed.

EnHx2KuEwpIeMFylyVLzVQ.text: Let my forewarn you, dear reader, that my entire experience at this restaurant, as at so many restaurants, was spent in a very pleasant mental fog induced by copious amounts of alcohol imbibed over the course of a warmish English summer's day.  Thus this review is more of a hazy recollection of the overall sensory experience of eating at Entrecote rather than a blow by blow account of what was quite a good meal.I arrived at Entrecote in my customary style:  stumbling out of a cab and most likely leaving the bill for some poor sod in my company to pay.  It's easy to sum up my first impressions:  "gee, that's a long line".  Entrecote doesn't take bookings and so unless you time your visit cleverly you will have to hang around outside for 20 or 30 minutes.  The most observant readers out there may have noticed that I was the slightest bit sozzled and might have inferred -- correctly -- that I was not the sharpest tool in the drawer at this point of the night.There followed a rather unpleasant minute or two in which I wondered how it would feel to be 20 minutes soberer in 20 minutes time, when my next alcoholic beverage could presumably be procured.  I was fortunately saved from the deep depression this sobering thought (excuse the pun) engendered by a rather wonderful group of lesbians in front of me who most ingeniously went to the pub across the street and came back with a tray of drinks!  This made the wait in the queue pass in a most agreeable fashion.Second impression:  good atmosphere.  Third impression:  where's the menu?  Entrecote serve...well, entrecote and frites.  And salad.  And wine.  And bread.  I think that's about it.  Your only choice is how you want your meat done.  Being "un snob bourré" I of course ordered mine blue.Fourth impression:  my plate is empty.  Fifth impression:  my plate magically refills itself!  This is the only restaurant I've ever been in where you get the exact same meal served to you twice.  Most innovative.The food was pretty good, and from recollection was 20 pounds or so which for London seems OK value.  Of course our bill was far more than that due to the wine I kept ordering.  Following Hemmingway's maxim "Any man who eats dessert is not drinking enough", I didn't have dessert so I can't vouch for that.  I did have another bottle of wine though.

04ucx3BJ668bTIULi7tzzg.text: Really good steak frittes!  Got there right before the rush at 6:30.

xxW-ocJXtI0zK3VHuNV46A.text: Good lord, this place is amazing.  I ate here back in November and honestly it's one of the things I remember most from my brief stay in London.  I can understand why this place is a chain, there should be one in every city.  As for the details - expect to wait in line. But it is worth the wait. I went on a Friday night and as long as the line was, it kept moving. The food, i.e. the one thing you can eat there, is really something. Steak and fries with the "mystery" sauce, that's it. I say mystery because apparently it's a pretty well guarded secret.  I've found from talking with coworkers that everyone has their opinions as to what's in it.  It's a fun game to play while you eat. After you clean your plate and reflect on the great meal you just had, the waitress appears like an angel with the second helping. The house wine was decent and the price for the meal was well below the high quality of the food. We also tried a few of the deserts, which is crazy considering how full we were after the main course. It was worth the loosening of the belt.Seriously recommended!

MKv87m5p2hrTVN8KoEFzbA.text: Like all the other reviews so, this place is an obsession.  Found it by accident, was wondering why there was a line around the corner.  Great neighborhood location by the way.  We got right in on a weekday night.  Knew up front no menu. You get a green salad with a walnut dressing, steak, fries that's it.  They have wine and beer too.  The steak comes with this magical green sauce that they won't tell you because it's a secret recipe.  We devoured our steak and fries and then all of a sudden you get more steak and fries!  This place was so addicting and am so happy we have one here in NYC because I need to go back!

HebgNjd_HKcD8-kWgyyivQ.text: If your in the Marylebone area, this restaurant is a must !  If u love steak & frites this is place 4 you!  Delicious ! Be prepared 2 wait ! No reservation.

5pSLkhxP3kJCaIJDW4QYeg.text: Perfect for a quick and tasty lunch, with a set menu starting with a tangy green salad, and then perfectly portioned slices of beef drenched in that yummy secret sauce that you'll crave even after being done with it, and a side of thin but flavorful french fries. There's a list of deserts you can end your meal with but I do especially recommend the crème brulé. The atmosphere can be great or dreadful depending on who you ask, being a loud, almost always crowded place can put off some but also, in the right mood, be quite fun! The lack of the ability to book before coming is unfortunate considering the queue that can go on for half an hour at times (though I didn't see one the last time I went), but you owe it to yourself to at least try that heavenly-sauce-drenched slices steak!

L9AC9SpPZvEY2jeZDA8njw.text: Relais de Venise is a Parisian born phenomenon. Its original Paris bistro opened in 1959 by Paul Gineste de Saurs, who merely sought a place to serve his family's Château de Saurs wines. Opting for an especially short and traditional bistro menu of a simple salad (lettuce, walnuts and potent mustard vinaigrette), steak-frites with a butter-based secret recipe sauce of herbs, spices and condiments along with a few particularly moreish desserts (save room for the profiteroles!), the no nonsense bistro soon won fans for its quality over variety dining experience. It also won a reputation for its strict no reservations policy. Legend tells of married couples meeting on queue and of people securing their next job while waiting for their Frenchy meat and potatoes chow down. Based on my experience dining at the Marylebone Lane Relais (but without yet having the pleasure of visiting the flagship in Paris or their other London location in the City), I reckon the food's worth a bit of a wait. The flavoursome frites - made of Bintje potatoes from France that are hand chipped daily on the premises using a bespoke chipper to ensure a signature 7mm thin slice  are out of this world, and the much speculated upon but never revealed secret sauce is a most delectable accompaniment. Here in London, the bistros serve Donald Russell steaks from Aberdeenshire beef (supplier to HM The Queen) for their entrecote steak (which they'll even serve blue). An order of salad and main course is priced at £20 per person and yields a more than ample amount of food. Puds cost around £5. A glass of house red is £4.25. Vegetarians are welcome, and as a substitute for the steak a selection of cheeses is offered and a dessert is included for the same price of £20. Service is perfunctory and fast.

ShVwfuBwv7HtUV9P8srusA.text: When I've had a really bad day, I want to leave work and have a stress-free evening. This involves an easy choice of venue for dinner, reliably good food, maybe an affordable bottle of wine, and a food-induced coma putting me to sleep. For these nights, Relais delivers.The two locations are convenient for me (The City, and Marylebone), and the food never disappoints. From the walnut salad to the expertly trimmed steak and decadent secret sauce, and just as importantly the very affordable, highly tasty house wine, it is a sure thing that always puts a smile on my face.No reservations means the usual dilemma: (1) arrive before opening to beat the line, or (2) get in the queue and wait your turn. The line moves fast, and is expectedly shorter in the winter, so that helps, but in general, it moves very quickly. To facilitate this, though, you do give up some service during the meal, but as long as you have the right mindset going into it, that is manageable.As for the price, at twenty pounds a head, its a little steep. But there's just nothing else like it, and when you see the demand, you can't really blame them.Four stars for delivering on ease, food, wine, and coma. I'll be here often!

hAagvGwBUB8LXXtjWFMtrA.text: when in Rome...or when in London really, L'Entrecote is the best place in London to get a bloody (quite literally) steak and fries.I'm a pseudo-vegetarian ie I love meat but try to avoid ithowever, I splurged a few summer's ago when I had a not-s0-fully-cooked steak here. The place has this whole old school feel, lyke all Victorian era and shizzle Basically you drink wine like it's ribena (its cheap) and pretend you're in France for a dinner.yeah the sauce is real good. real saucy.

oEzKiacCFcrQaGQNLxFTLA.text: I wanted to go to the Paris-based restaurant, but the lines were always so ridiculous that I never made it out there in the four months I spent there.Before coming here, I had spent the day eating half the section of Borough and having cake at Selfridge's.  Since my visiting friend INSISTED on going, I took a little digestive nap (if that even exists) and dragged myself over here, still digesting the raclette and oreo cupcake from 3 hours ago. Oh my god I'm so glad I came. At first I kept grumbling about spending £20 on a set meal I wasn't even hungry for, but I killed this meal like it was my first in days.  You get the only choice of walnut/endive salad and choose how your meat is to be cooked.  When I received my first plate, I was a bit turned off by how small it was. But waiiiiiit, 2/3 way through I get a second plate. More meat! With some successful flirting by my friends, we get a massive dosage of fries.  The sauce is made JUST as sauce should be made in French steak de boeuf avec frites. I was so happy leaving here. SO disgustingly full, but so happy. It does get very busy and you may feel a little rushed at times, but who cares. Go.

-hGH0Dvtg4GvpzDt8bgZ9Q.text: A very worthy sibling of Relais de Venise in the City (Throgmorton Street), this one has a ri-di-cu-lous queue starting from the moment it opens. Especially on Saturday evenings. The secret is, of course, that it's open on Saturday, at least. The City one is shut.Oh, and when you dine at either of them, keep your receipt, and you'll get 20% off your next lunch in Marylebone or dinner in the City. (there's a time limit of about a month or so)

dQ1juLCN9oJnwiE0Sn3peQ.text: Not remotely worth £20.If you advertise yourself as The Place to Go for steak frites, you had better be good. First the good things: the ambiance was noisy and convivial, the salad was excellent and the frites were spot on.The steak, however, came in a roughly 6 ounce serving, drowned in a pleasant but nondescript green sauce. The meat under the sauce could just as easily have been mushrooms chicken or tofu. There were seconds, which brought the total steak serving up to around 9 ounces.So  £20 seems to me a lot to pay for a salad and frites, however good. Seldom has this happened, but I really felt ripped off.Go get a steak frites at your local, you will almost certainly get better quality at a better price.

WNzoDqtnEV74wF81Rh9ZQg.text: Here's one American who didn't think this place was all that amazing.  Before I get lambasted, here are the reasons why.  1) It was marketed to me as a great one-of-a-kind establishment, but it turns out they're a chain with locations all around the world.  2) Rushed service - since everyone knows what you're basically going to order, wine/bread/salad/steak/frites are essentially dumped out in front of you.3) I really hate it when waitresses ask you for still or sparkling, you say still, and they pop the cap off an expensive bottle of Evian.  Well, you won't get me again - I say tap water everywhere I go now.4) Nothing was that amazing.  The salad had this garlic dressing (in all honesty, it's been a while, the flavor might not have been garlic, but it was really strong whatever it was) that completely overpowered the rest of the salad, the steak had only what seemed to be a watered-down curry flavor, and the frites were tiny.  I also didn't love when they gave me more food.  Now don't get me wrong, I do love getting free food, but the way they present it has all the trappings of shoveling gruel on your plate.  The desserts looked amazing, and I ordered this macaroon tower, but they also failed to impress.5)  Finally, I realize they can do nothing about this, but does every freakin' person in the UK smoke?  Waiting in the 1 hour queue, we were continually blasted by smoke.  On the other hand, the two people waiting behind us were a lot of fun - a great way to meet new people.  Anyways, if I ever want to eat here again, (and I don't), I'll just go to one of the US locations...no reason to go to a US chain when I'm overseas, and I won't be making that mistake again.

NhaT3F5mhEBDnLnVfrcV9A.text: Such a simple concept, but one of the most enjoyable evenings I've had in a while. They don't take reservations so you start by queuing outside the restaurant, but with the heat lamps and company it can be quite an enjoyable wait. Once you're seated you are presented with a fairly bland looking salad of greens, walnuts and mustard dressing accompanied by freshly baked French bread. But as I learned last night, looks can be deceiving. The mustard dressing is complex in flavour and makes the salad truly spectacular. You are then given one choice, how would you like your steak cooked... rare, medium or well done. It's positively criminal to order anything other than rare. But don't worry, although rare arrives very red in colour, it does not bleed all over the plate. The steak is covered in a mystery green sauce. I have no idea what's in it, but wow it's delicious. And of course the steak is accompanied by piles of frites. Just when you think you're starting to feel full, a second helping of steak and frites are served. I ate the steak (how can you not?), but had to leave the frites so I would have room for dessert.  To accompany our meal we had the house red, again it was fantastic, perfectly complementing the meal. Desserts are also delicious. I would recommend the profiteroles that are served with ice-cream instead of cream. All this and just £20 a head + wine and dessert. Not a bad deal at all!

put8SZkbWNv4QJNBGDQ6Jg.text: Just found this place by accident. What a find!  The menu never changes -- but who cares?  It's a great one!  Delicious salad, steak with yummy sauce and perfectly cooked chips.Best to go early as a queue develops outside. Don't take reservations and won't seat you until all members of your party are present.They do have a vegetarian option.

gR_UjidZybbpgB8fi0-wXA.text: This is quite the bizarre yet cute and cosy little place in Marylebone. I think that from over a hundred reviews it's obvious that it serves only one type of food - steak. I asked for my take to be medium rare and washed it down with a glass of red wine. It is as simple as that but the meal is truly worth it the long line that will surely wait for you no matter when you go. That being the main setback, consider the place a lovely dinner option and a real treat if you're a steak-lover like me.

Sygt5RhOY7VL0A1X-AVkcA.text: After months of wanting to come here, but knowing about the queues, we were finally out and about in London and ready to eat right about the time they opened, so I figured it would be the perfect time to go (as no queue, right?) Luckily I was right and we got right in.The menu, easy, steak and fries. And a salad to start. We get our salads and order our wine. The wine comes, the waitress opens it, pours a partial glass (for tasting I assume) and then sets the wine down on the table and walks off? What? Um, shouldn't you wait to make sure the wine is okay before you just leave in on the table and disappear. I mean, if it's not, I suppose we don't have to pour it and drink it, but given the servers come around practically never, that's really not an option. So I take a sip, and joking look over my shoulder, "Oh yes, that's great thanks!" Then the wine turns out to be NOT the wine we ordered. Luckily it was a cheaper wine, so we didn't feel so bad about drinking it, and it was quite tasty, but still, why can't the waitress remember what wine to bring? At this point I comment that perhaps they're going for the authentic French experience: rude waitstaff. Except that every place I've been to in France, they've been more than courteous and not at all rude, so clearly if that's what they're going for, they'd going for the stereotype.The steaks arrived. They are arranged fairly unattractively on a small plate with a pile of chips on the side. It was decidingly unattractive and unappealing. You'd think a restaurant that does ONE dish would be able to do it in a way that actually makes it appealing to eat. It also seemed a bit small, but for some unknown reason (because it keeps the food hot maybe? I don't really know) they bring a second portion of the food around when you're done.The food though, yeah it was good. The steak was cooked rare and the sauce was tasty. The chips were also great (and I used some of the mustard on them, tasty). Weirdly though, the steak itself was kind of chewy and not really that great. Again, you'd think a restaurant that ONLY MAKES THIS DISH would make it perfectly. I can cook a better steak at home. Who are the chefs that work here?We get dessert: The other half orders cheese and I order the raspberry tart. I then get up to use the bathroom, and when I return, there are two strawberry tarts on the table. Um, I ordered raspberry. So I can see why they only do one dish now, because that way the servers don't have to remember what people order because clearly they can't. About five minutes later, the cheese finally comes. They serve my other half up some cheese (and it's a lot of cheese, be prepared if you order the cheese for dessert). I mention that they brought the wrong tarts. The server gave me the ugliest stare for even mentioning that it was wrong, but they said they'd bring me the correct tarts. Then they say they'll bring bread for the cheese. Afterwards, I turn to my other half and say, "Hmm, I wonder which they'll bring first, the tarts or the bread". Turns out I won, as the tarts turned up. I slowly start eating my tarts (which were quite tasty), and no bread shows up. Finally, I turn around and grab some random person walking by and say, "Can we get some bread for the cheese?"She gets bread, then notices that they didn't bring a knife for the cheese (at least this one noticed), so she ran off to get the bread. The cheese turned out quite nice, but we paid the bill and left, and noticed the queue outside the door as we walked away.Bottom line: The steaks were alright, nothing special. The desserts were good. It's worth the price, but not the wait, so go if you're planning on going early, but not if you're planning on waiting in the queue. The service is definitely not worth it (and given they only do ONE dish, you'd think they'd be WAY more organized than they actually are). And honestly, I had a better steak at La Petite Maison (and hey they actually take reservations, so you don't have to queue). I'm beginning to think that Londoners actually just really like queuing, regardless of the quality of product they'll be receiving (Monmouth coffee anyone?). Herd mentality, maybe? I don't know, but I'll be dining elsewhere for steak thank you.

6M-xGFaTCWq6F4ojMKAznw.text: Summary: Great steak, good fries, fun experience.Came on a weekday night around 9 PM - and there was still a 20 min wait to get in.Salad was good, but not spectacular. I ordered the steak rare, which it was. Fries were good when hot, but didn't hold their crispness throughout the meal, which was unfortunate. Seeing the servers and how they dealt with keeping the steak warm was interesting. I like the idea of keeping the meat warm - I personally think it's a waste to let a juicy, oozing piece of meat turn into a cold steak with congealed fat.Would come back again with a friend if they waned, but probably not by myself anytime soon due to the inconvenience factor.

mYALjwkLiGFKPN7gOAOIeA.text: Excellent.  Really fun place with a great but simple menu - salad, steak, chips and red wine.  Crowded, but worth the wait.  Friendly, authentic staff too.

EkhmeYm1hSFsbxc-wzHy1w.text: Salad. Steak. Chips.  That's it.  One set menu for a mere £19 - take it or leave it.  And people are taking it... queuing up for it in fact.I'm actually a vegetarian, so I've never dined here... but my friends *rave.*  They talk about how amazing the beef is... how the secret signature sauce is mouthwatering... and what a unique and impressive place this is to bring a date (provided they're a carnivore).This London branch is a replica of the original successful establishment in Paris that's been a popular Parisian brasserie for nearly 50 years.  I love the simplicity of the concept, the secrecy of the sauce, and the established Parisan history... it all sounds so neat... if you're a beef eater at all, I highly suggest ye get thee here...

photos.caption: Photo of Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote - London, United Kingdom. The Meal

E-51q86Ot0yMp_CteLDo6A.text: Perhaps it's a case of the Yelp curse- a well-rated restaurant with reviews that set your expectations so high, even a great restaurant couldn't possibly live up to the hype- but I wasn't all that impressed. If you stumbled on this restaurant and had no idea what it was, you'd probably rate it 2 stars. Why? Let's see. After waiting outside (not terrible I must admit) you're rushed into a jam-packed restaurant, only to be sat at a table so close to the one next to it that it must be pulled all the way out before it's shoved back trapping you in the booth. Then you're met by a "waitress" who appears to be dressed for Halloween who asks only "how do you want it cooked." At this point you had better have figured out you're there for steak, or you're screwed. They then scribble your preference on a paper table cloth and are gone. Someone else comes by less than 30 seconds later, throws a forgettable salad down and disappears. Five minutes later a different waitress returns, tosses down a plate of steak smothered in watery green sauce and overcooked, soggy fries and is gone. Sure you get two servings, but I'd trade quality over quantity any day. In short:Service? Non-existent, and my standards are low. Steak? I've had better off a George Foreman grill. Green sauce? Seemed a bit watery and rather flavorless given all the hype. This can't be the best London can do. Overall? Not terrible, but certainly not five stars. I thought the meal was "good," but certainly not exceptional. Full disclosure: I lived in Texas for a few years, so maybe I'm biased, but I've had better steak at even upscale chain restaurants like Ruth's Chris, and better fries at Five Guys. Go for the experience, if you must, but set expectations accordingly.

En8Nu1bW6Bmd8wWVk5zdXA.text: I need to come back here more often.  I always go with rare (equals to about medium cooked steak in NY) and the house wine is quite good.  I don't know what's in that green sauce but it is absolutely brilliant.

lb36tx4NBjzQ3s3-P-7cmA.text: Some places lose a step when they aren't busy, this place, with the high art that is the timing of fries and thin meat, loses about about 10. The salad is still great, but not overly generous. All this even after I got a free bottle of wine. Hmm?

p9ftVrrIk4L6g0LpO0O7YA.text: Find something simple and do it well.  Relais takes this formula and does it in spades.  Tender, flavourful entrecôte topped with mouth-watering butter herb sauce, perfectly cooked fries, and fresh green salad.  Being first-timers here, we were pleasantly surprised when our server came by to offer us MORE slices of juicy bovine after we had already finished our first portion of what I thought was a generous helping already.  The idea is they serve half first, then keep the other half on a warmer so that your steak never gets cold.  The atmosphere is bustling; the waitresses pretty and efficient.  Oh and a French family were gorging themselves next to our table so that's always a good sign.  Thumbs up!

L1F5uejmdX0VUetYb2B1Wg.text: So upon arriving at this restaurant, we realized that there was a line. What we didn't realize right away was that line went all the way around the block. My friend and I decided we'd go somewhere else. As we were about to leave, we saw them letting in 10 people so we turned back around and decided we'd stick it out. My point here is that the line goes at a moderate pace. We ended up waiting about 30-35 minutes until we were seated.The concept is simple, you sit down, you get a salad and bread as a starter, french fries and steak as the main course. You can get a second serving of the steak and fries but that's it. No thirds. The fries were delicious. I like the thin french fries instead of the thick chips they sell here in the UK. The steak was delicious and the sauce (bernaise?) was even better. I give them 5 stars for the food and 3 stars for their service. So....4 stars altogether.

9sQqlCx3ycIxXQ4nTZt07Q.text: Excellent steak and endless fries! The special sauce is really delicious! It's hard for me to pin point what's in it. I've been here a couple if times and although its not cheap, I walk out very satisfied. It's a really nice place, the service is excellent and the steak is really perfectly cooked and served. The bread, salad and fries given are also very delicious and fresh. They have perfected every item that will be served up. Great place to take someone for something nice or for a small group of friends.

jfkeYA7v_ZOogDzpLVJqCw.text: Fucking amazing. Worth the wait, the line. Steak frites, meat baby ...yummmm.

rdEcd_62Kx8yyjAwxmBFZA.text: The meat they served was very well prepared (I got it cooked exactly as I ordered) and definitely of the good quality. Chips were good. However, the restaurant was very crowded and be aware for a long queue if u pop in at night.

Fx4gcBdbBIcRyldFdNuzFQ.text: Yes, I am a big fan! I love french food and really enjoyed my time here. They start by asking how you want the meat, I took a star off cus I got medium and it was a bit too cooked. Next time I will get the rare. Other than that, the frites and wine were pure bliss.AND, for desert i had profiterol, and they were one of the most amazing desserts ever!! yum yum yum.It was quiet pricey but well worth it when you have great company.

BpgnLm0z7XdrylICBVEgYA.text: I will be eternally grateful to my friend Aymen for introducing me to this place. The queue is worth it trust me. Just go and tell me otherwise. I thought about asking for ketchup and was quickly shot down. They take their food seriously here and so they should. The green sauce is amazing on its own,with the perfectly cooked steak and with the fries. The waitresses outfits are also cool ;)
